description.narrative:
The Love Alliance, a new five-year programme (2021-2025), is based on an unwavering commitment to protecting, promoting and fulfilling sexual and reproductive health and rights (SRHR) globally, unifying people who use drugs, sex workers and LGBTIQ+ movements, and amplifying the diversity of voices in these communities.
Funded by the Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the Love Alliance brings together national thought leaders GALZ, SANPUD and Sisonke, regional grantmakers UHAI EASHRI, AFE and ISDAO, with the global network of people living with HIV (GNP+) and the Netherlands-based administrative lead Aidsfonds.
Together, we advocate for adequate levels of funding and for taking truly human rights-based programmes to scale. We take this opportunity to prioritise and invest in challenging the structural barriers of underfunding, criminalisation and exclusion of us in all our diversity.

title.narrative: L1: Key population movements are capable, inclusive, influential and mutually supportive
L1.1 Key populations effectively use accountability mechanisms towards SRHR

comment.narrative: Systematic accountability for SRHR is limited, though the Key Populations TWG provides a venue for raising some SRHR issues.

title.narrative: S1: Diverse KP communities are organised and meaningfully inclusive and have strengthened their capacity to claim their rights and freedoms.
S1.2 # of civil society organisations and community led organisations with increased capacity to advocate for the rights of key populations

L2: Civic space and freedoms of key populations and civil society actors is preserved and expanded and progress is made towards decriminalisation of sex work, marginalised gender identities, same sex relationships, HIV and the possession and use of drugs
L2.2 # of Policies formally blocked/retracted (bills, bonds, ballot measures, regulations, administrative policies) related to either civic space and freedoms or (de)criminalisation
L2.1 # of Policies formally proposed/accepted (bills, bonds, ballot measures, regulations, administrative policies etc.) related to either civic space and freedoms or (de)criminalisation.
L3: Key populations have access to inclusive, non-judgemental, gender sensitive people centred accountable and comprehensive HIV and SRH services that are adequately and sustainably resourced.
L3.1 # of policies/laws/strategies currently being implemented to meet the needs of key populations as a result of programme contribution
